This course introduces students to the basic knowledge representation and learning methods 
of artificial intelligence. The emphasis will be on understanding the fundamental artificial 
intelligence concepts, as well as being able to practically apply the corresponding approaches 
in solving practical problems and developing useful software applications. Covered topics 
include: intelligent agents, informed and uninformed search strategies, adversarial search, 
MDP, CSP, State of the Art AI topics.

1. General introduction to Artificial Intelligence, Algorithms and Heuristics, 
Introduction to graphs, fully and not fully connected graphs, directed and undirected 
graphs, representing a simple game as a graph
2. Intelligent agents, Agent Design, Solving Problems with Search, Blind (Uninformed) 
search techniques, DFS, BFS. Heuristic search techniques, Iterative Deepening, 
Uniform Cost, Greedy Search, A* Search, Admissible Heuristic
3. Local Search Methods, Example Map Coloring, Local Search Example, Hill 
Climbing, Simulated Annealing. 
4. Game Trees: Minimax, Expectimax, Utilities
5. Markov Decision Processes
6. Reinforcement Learning, Bayesian reinforcement Learning, Bayes Nets
7. Decision Networks, Markov Models, HMMs

9. Special Topics: Robotics, NLP, Computer Vision, Connected Autonomous Electric
